__e: And one morning, it was a lovely day, I made him a picnic lunch, and I took Lenny, and I went out into the field.
Lenny is so nice to me, much much much nicer than I am to him.
Just wouldn't work, cos I'd never know... why you were doing or saying anything.
Because Lenny hasn't decided what to do with him yet.
I am the Pope, and you, Lenny, are no longer a member of the Church.
I think it's because maybe Lenny isn't the one.
He should be with me. - And he should be with me. - He needs me, too.
I talked to my Uncle Lenny ... he can take you.

Lenny offered me a new life, a new home, a new family.
Lenny tells me you still won't visit your father.
